sentences: Ma ei tea, kuidas ta seda teeb, aga ta peab selle ära tegema.
context: The Estonian word 'peab' is the third-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'pidama'. It means 'must', 'has to', or 'needs to' and indicates obligation, necessity, or requirement. This is used when talking about what someone (he/she/it) must do or needs to do in the present tense.
